headline: Dominion Energy (D): Evaluating Valuation After $1.25 Billion Subordinated Notes Reshape Capital Structure
summary: Dominion Energy (D) has just wrapped up a $1.25 billion offering of junior subordinated notes due 2056. These new fixed income instruments, which feature variable rates and callable terms, are prompting investors to revisit the company’s capital structure. See our latest analysis for Dominion Energy. Dominion Energy’s capital moves arrive as its share price holds steady around $61.53, with momentum remaining muted in recent months. Total shareholder return over the past year is just 10.7%,...
